intro: Trifolium aristatum, commonly known as the upright clover, is a flowering plant native to Europe and parts of Asia. It is characterized by its trifoliate leaves, each composed of three oval-shaped leaflets with a slightly serrated edge. The plant produces small, white or pale pink flowers arranged in clusters, which bloom in early summer. Trifolium aristatum thrives in well-drained soils and is often found in meadows, grasslands, and disturbed areas. It is a member of the legume family and has the ability to fix nitrogen, making it an important plant in soil enrichment.
